1049729181649637376.text:
Thx for RTs, but I used my time to investigate more.

Problem was very simple: Netlink socket is opened for a family and there're only 32 with about 20 preassigned. I used a custom (unregistered) family.
Afterwards the socket is bound to PID (0 for kernel). Can't be done twice https://twitter.com/mame82/status/1048655072224301058 …

1049730193986908160.text:
The solution: use generic netlink family (multiplexing socket)

Benefit: Opens the door to nl80211, which is based on it.

Shortcomings:
1) More code overhead
2) Kernel api differs between 4.9.x and 4.14.x
3) More go bindings needed == more delay till release of P4wnp1 successor

1049731212124848131.text:
What does it mean:
P4wnP1 will be tied to Kernel 4.14 (no more support for raspbian on kernel 4.9)

The go bindings are already finished, thanks to the great blog posts of @mdlayher (wrote custom ones, but he has great go repos for NL/GENL/nl80211).

Problem:
- target kernel is 4.14
- two independent modules should send netlink multicast from kernel to userspace
